S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Azimuth Degrees
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The horizontal direction or bearing of a celestial point from a terrestrial point, expressed as the angular distance from a reference direction. It is usually measured from 000 at the reference direction clockwise through 360.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Values must not be less than 000 or more than 359. Particular attention should be given to the definition of an attribute using azimuthDegrees. It could be used as direction from or direction to.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Beaufort Force
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Wind force scale, originally based on the state of the sea, expressed in numbers from 0 to 12.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: light air
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 1 and 3 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 1)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: light breeze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 4 and 6 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 2).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gentle breeze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 7 and 10 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 3).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: moderate breeze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 11 and 16 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 4).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fresh breeze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 17 and 21 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 5).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: strong breeze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 22 and 27 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 6).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: near gale
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 28 and 33 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 7).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gale
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 34 and 40 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 8).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: strong gale
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 41 and 47 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 9).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: storm
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 48 and 55 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 10).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: violent storm
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed between 56 and 63 knots (Beaufort scale wind force 11).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: hurricane force
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wind with a speed 64 knots and above (Beaufort scale wind force 12).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: calm wind
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Absence of air motion or wind with a speed of less than 1 knot (Beaufort scale wind force 0).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cardinal Direction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Principal and intermediate compass points.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: north
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: 348.75-011.25 degrees (true north)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Convergent Boundary
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The particular type of boundary in which air masses have similar densities.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Intertropical convergence zone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Narrow zone where the trade winds of the two hemispheres meet.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Squall line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A non-frontal line or narrow band of thunderstorms (with or without squalls)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Trough
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A line along which pressures are lower than the surrounding area in the cyclonic curvature of the isobars or contours is a maximum.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shear line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Line along which there is an abrupt change in the horizontal wind component parallel to this line.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Convergence line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Line along which the horizontal convergence is a maximum.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Monsoon trough
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The portion of the intertropical convergence zone which extends into or through a monsoon circulation; this line coincides with the maximum cyclonic curvature vorticity with southwesterly monsoon flow prevailing south of the trough axis.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tropical wave
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A trough or cyclonic curvature maximum in the trade wind easterlies. The wave may reach maximum amplitude in the lower middle troposphere or may be the reflection of an upper tropospheric cold low or an equatorward extension of a mid-latitude trough.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Front
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The specific type of interface or transition zone between air masses of different densities.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cold front
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any non-occluded front which moves in such a way that cold air replaces relatively warmer air.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Warm front
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any non-occluded front which moves in such a way that warm air replaces cold air.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Occluded front
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A composite of two fronts, formed as a cold front overtakes a warm front or quasi-stationary front.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Quasi-stationary front
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A front which is stationary or nearly so (conventionally, moving with a speed less than five knots).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dry line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Narrow zone, other than a warm, cold, or occluded front, across which there is a distinct gradient in the moisture content of the air near the Earth's surface.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Precipitation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Type or physical state of an ensemble of particles consisting of a fall.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Duplication of categoryOfPrecipitation values is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Rain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation of liquid water particles, either in the form of drops of more than 0.5 mm in diameter, or of smaller widely scattered drops

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: drizzle
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Fairly uniform precipitation in very fine drops of water (diameter less than 0.5 mm) very close to one another, falling from a cloud

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Freezing rain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation drops freezing on impact to form a coating of clear ice (glaze) on the ground and on exposed objects

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: freezing drizzle
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation, in the form of drizzle, freezing on impact to form a coating of clear ice (glaze) on the ground and on exposed objects.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Hail
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation of either transparent, or partly or completely opaque particles of ice (hailstones), usually spheroidal, conical or irregular in form and of diameter very generally between 5 and 50 millimetres, which falls from a cloud either separately or agglomerated into irregular lumps

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Snow
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation of ice crystals, isolated or agglomerated, falling from a cloud

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sleet
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation of rain, which passes through a freezing layer and changes into transparent or partly or completely opaque particles of ice.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Other/Unknown Precipitation Type
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation of unknown composition or differing from common precipitation types.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category Of Low
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Category Of Low

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extra-tropical cyclone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: extra-tropical cyclone

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: post-tropical cyclone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: post-tropical cyclone

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: thermal low
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: thermal low

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: polar low
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: polar low

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Saffir Simpson Category
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson Category

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saffir Simpson category 1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson category 1

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saffir Simpson category 2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson category 2

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saffir Simpson category 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson category 3

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saffir Simpson category 4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson category 4

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saffir Simpson category 5
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Saffir Simpson category 5

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Reduced Visibility
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Type or category of atmospheric particles that reduce the horizontal surface visibility.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Duplication of categoryOfReducedVisibility values is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dust
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Haze caused by the suspension in the atmosphere of small sand or dust particles

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fog
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suspension of very small, usually microscopic water droplets in the air, generally reducing the horizontal visibility at the Earth’s surface to less than 1 km

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: haze
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suspension in the atmosphere of extremely small, dry particles which are invisible to the naked eye but numerous enough to give the sky an opalescent appearance

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: smoke
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suspension in the atmosphere of small particles produced by combustion

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mist
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suspension in the air of microscopic water droplets or wet hygroscopic particles which reduce the visibility at the Earth’s surface.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: other/unknown visibility type
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suspension in the atmosphere of very small unknown particles.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Coverage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Percentage used to indicate how much of a geographic area a feature is affecting or forecasted to affect within a defined geographic area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Time End
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The end of a time range, expressed in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: 19850412T183059 denotes 18 hours, 30 minutes, and 59 seconds on 12 April 1985.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Time Start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The beginning of a time range, expressed in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: 19850412T183059 denotes 18 hours, 30 minutes, and 59 seconds on 12 April 1985.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Definition
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A formal and concise statement of the meaning of a word, phase, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Display Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if a feature name is to be displayed in certain systemdisplay settings or not.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Where it is allowable to encode multiple instances of feature name for a single feature instance, only onefeature name instance can indicate that the name is to be displayed (display name set to True).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Display Track
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if a feature’s trajectory through time is to be displayed in certain system display settings or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: feature identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier referencing an object or feature that is external to the dataset, expressed in Uniform Resource Name (URN) format.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Forecasted Change in Intensity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Specifies the expected change in intensity of a feature in the upcoming 24 hours.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: much weakening
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The intensity of a feature is forecast to significantly decrease over the forecast period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: weakening
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The intensity of a feature is forecast to decrease over the forecast period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: no change in intensity
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The intensity of a feature is forecast to remain the same for the forecast period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: intensification
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A feature is forecast to increase its strength of the strength of its associated attributes (i.e.: wind, atmospheric pressure)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: strong intensification
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A feature is forecast to significantly increase its strength or the strength of its associated attributes (i.e.: wind, atmospheric pressure)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: intensity not observed previously
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The intensity change is unknown because there are no prior instances to reference.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: undetermined intensity change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The intensity change is unknown.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: headline
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Words set at the head of a passage or page to introduce or categorize

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Interval Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An integer value that represents an interval.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Units for the intervalValue is defined by timeUnits, or another enumerated attribute within the associated complex attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The language is encoded by a 3 character code following ISO 639-2/T.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Pressure Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The maximum pressure associated with a pressure system.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Units: hectopascal (hPa); 998.1 for an atmospheric pressure of 998.1 hPa; 1021.6 for an atmospheric pressure of 1021.6 hPa

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Message Category
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A designation meant to categorize message types.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A notification highlighting the imminent risk of or a high probability of an event which threatens the safety of navigation. It is intended to highlight conditions that pose a threat to life and property.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Watch
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A notification issued to alert mariners that the risk of or a high probability of an event has increased significantly, but its occurrence, location and/or timing is still uncertain. It is intended to provide enough lead time so that a mariner can take appropriate action.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Advisory
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A notification issued to caution mariners that conditions that affect the safety of life and property at sea are possible or likely. Advisories are for event that st hat may cause significant inconvenience, and if caution is not exercised, it could lead to situations that may threaten life and/or property.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: outlook
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A notification issued to notify mariners of an event, or series of events, further in time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: statement
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A generic notification

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: synopsis
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A condensation or brief review of a subject; summary

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Message Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An indication of the type of message

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: new message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A message that has not been previously disseminated

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cancellation message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A message indicating a previous message has been discontinued.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: repeated message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A rebroadcasted message

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: update message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A message containing corrected information for a previously disseminated message.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Issued Date Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Issued Date Time

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Country Name

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Pressure Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum pressure associated with a low pressure system.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: hectopascal (hPa); 998.1 for an atmospheric pressure of 998.1 hPa; 1021.6 for an atmospheric pressure of 1021.6 hPa

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Period Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value component of a period of time.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A reference to a pictorial representation of the feature.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Potential Tornadic Activity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An indication of the potential of phenomena consisting of violent whirlwinds, revealed by the presence of a cloud column or inverted cloud cone (funnel cloud), protruding from the base of a cumulonimbus, and of a ‘bush’ composed of water droplets raised from the surface of the sea.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Precipitation Rate
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The rate or intensity of which precipitation is falling or is forecasted to fall.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Light Precipitation Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation rates less than 2.5 millimetres per hour

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Moderate Precipitation Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation rates between 2.5 and 10.0 millimetres per hour

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Heavy Precipitation Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation rates over 10 millimetres per hour

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unknown Precipitation Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Precipitation rates are not known.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Probability Percentage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Percentage value represents the probability a defined parameter and threshold will be exceeded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Speed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The rate of motion of a feature.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Units are defined in the speedUnits attribute, e.g. metres per second (m/s)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Speed Units
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The units for description of speed.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Defines the units of speed for other attributes for the object to which SUNITS is assigned.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metres per second
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: metres per second

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Kilometres per hour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: kilometres per hour

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Miles Per Hour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: miles per hour

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Nautical Miles Per Hour (Knots)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: nautical miles per hour (knots)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A non-formatted digital text string.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Should be used, for example, to hold the information that is for short cautionary or explanatory notes. Therefore, text populated in text must not exceed 300 characters. Text may be in English, or in a national language. No formatting of text is possible within text. If formatted text, or text strings exceeding 300 characters, is required, then an alternate concept should be used.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time Units
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Measurement unit of time, as defined by the International System of Units (SI).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: seconds
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The duration of 9192631770 periods of the radiation cooresponding to the transition between two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the cesium 133 atom.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: minutes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: 60 seconds

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: hours
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: 60 minutes or 3600 seconds

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: days
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: 24 hours or 86400 seconds

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Valid Date Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time, expressed in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) for which an object and its attributes are valid or for which an observation was recorded.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: Years, months, days, hours, minutes, secondsResolution: 1 secondFormat: YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS, where Y is year, M is month, D is day, H is hour, M is minute, and S is secondExample: 19850412T183059 denotes 18 hours, 30 minutes, and 59 seconds on 12 April 1985

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Wmo Header
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Wmo Header

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Message Identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Message Identifier

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Issue Date Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Issue Date Time

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Next Update Date Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Next Update Date Time

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Locator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: File Locator

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: File Reference

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Mailing Address
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Mailing Address

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telephone Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Telephone Number

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Email Address
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Email Address

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Agency Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Agency Name

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Web Address
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Web Address

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Value of Atmospheric Pressure
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Pressure (force per unit area) exerted by the atmosphere on any surface by virtue of its weight; it is equivalent to the weight of a vertical column of air extending above a surface unit area to the outer limit of the atmosphere.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: hectopascal (hPa); 998.1 for an atmospheric pressure of 998.1 hPa; 1021.6 for an atmospheric pressure of 1021.6 hPa

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Value of Wind Speed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The ratio value of the distance covered by the air to the time taken to cover it at the surface.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: defined in the SUNITS attribute, e.g. metre per second (m/s)Resolution: 1 unit of wind speed, as defined in the SUNITS attribute.Example: 3 for a wind speed of 2.5 m/s to 3.4 m/s, or 13 for a wind speed of 12.8 kt

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Wind Speed Range
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Wind speed category for a tropical cyclone.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: less than 34 knots
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Range of wind used to identify wind speeds less than 34 knots.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: 34 knots - 63 knots
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Range of wind used to denote tropical cyclone portrayals and identify wind speeds between 34 and 63 knots.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Greater than or equal to 64 knots
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Range of wind used to identify wind speeds greater than or equal to 64 knots.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: date time range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The range of time a feature is valid for.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: direction to
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The directional characteristics of a feature, described as the direction the feature is moving toward.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Feature Name
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides the name of an entity, defines the national language of the name, and provides the option to display the name at various system display settings.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: feature reference
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: reference to an object or feature that is external to the dataset.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: graphic
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Pictorial information such as a photograph, sketch or other graphic, optionally accompanied by descriptive information about the graphic and the location relative to its subject from which it was made.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: language text
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A combination of written text and a language indication.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: maximum sustained wind speed
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: When applied to a particular weather system, refers to the highest average wind (at an elevation of 10 metres with an unobstructed exposure) associated with that weather system at a particular point in time.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: movement
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The speed and directional characteristics of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: name definition
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: An indication of the name and definition of a modeled concept.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: picture caption
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Short description of the purpose of a graphic.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: picture information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A set of information to provide credits to picture creator, copyright owner, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: pressure change rate
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time interval at which atmospheric pressure changes over.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: time interval
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The range of time for which a phenomena is valid

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: weather message
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A weather or sea bulletin that highlights conditions that impact the safety of navigation.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: wind average period
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The period of time over which wind is averaged.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Time 1
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to the earlier feature within a temporal range

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Component of
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: a pointer to a part in a whole-part relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Information provided for
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific feature(s) for which further information is required.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Time 2
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to the later feature within a temporal range

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Polygon area
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a polygonal region for a feature over a temporal range

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Moving Feature
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a feature that is moving through time

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Polygon Track
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to the linear connection between a moving feature

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Data Provider Information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an object that provides information about the data providers for the particular object

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The Message
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a feature that contains a meteorological message

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Message Information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to supplemental information for a meteorological message

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Data Provider Association
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: An association that binds information about the data provider to features

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Additional Message Information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: : An association that binds hazard message information to the a hazard message geographic feature

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Time Association
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for binding instances of the same feature through time

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Track Composition
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association binding a surface geometry to the linear representation of a cyclone’s forecasted track. This represents spatial uncertainty for a tropical cyclone’s forecasted position

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Tropical Cyclone Track
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association that binds together instances of tropical cyclone point features to create a linear representation of the cyclone’s track through time

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: S-412 InformationType
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: An S-412 specific type for an identifiable object carrying supplementary information for other objects.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Data Provider
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: An organization or entity providing a data in an official capacity.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Weather Hazard Message Information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Supplementary information accompanying a weather message.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: S-412 FeatureType
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An S-412 specific type for an abstract representation of a real world phenomenon.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Weather System
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An atmospheric phenomena involving perturbations of the prevailing pressure and wind fields.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: High
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The region of the atmosphere where the pressures are high relative to those in the surrounding region at the same level. The point of highest pressure in an area of high pressure.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Low
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Region of the atmosphere in which the pressures are lower than those of the surrounding region at the same level. Point of the lowest pressure in the Low Pressure Area. Represents non-tropical lows.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Convergent Boundary
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The interface or transition zone between air masses of similar densities (temperature, humidity).

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Front
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The interface or transition zone between air masses of different densities (temperature, humidity).

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ridge
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Region of the atmosphere in which the pressure is high relative to the surrounding region at the same level. It is represented on a synoptic chart by a system of nearly parallel isobars or contours, approximately U-shape, which are concave towards an anticyclone. A ridge line is where the curvature of the isobars or contours is maximum.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Squall
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Atmospheric phenomenon characterized by an abrupt and large increase of wind speed with the duration of the order of minutes which decreases rather suddenly. It is often accompanied by showers or thunderstorms.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Thunderstorm
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Sudden electrical discharges manifested by a flash of light (lightning) and a sharp or rumbling sound (thunder). Thunderstorms are associated with convective clouds (Cumulonimbus) and are, more often, accompanied by precipitation in the form of rain showers or hail, or occasionally snow, snow pellets, or ice pellets.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Tropical Cyclone
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Generic term for a non-frontal synoptic scale cyclone originating over tropical or sub-tropical waters with organized convection and definite cyclone surface wind circulation.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: -"Feature name" should be populated with official WMO tropical cyclone name. The name shoudl populate both "Display name" and "Name" under the complex attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Cyclone Track
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A representation of the forecast track of the center of a tropical cyclone

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Cone of Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A representation of the probable track of the center of a tropical cyclone.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Weather Hazard Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific weather scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Tropical Cyclone Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific tropical cyclone scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Thunderstorm Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific thunderstorm scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: High Wind Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific high wind scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Freezing Spray Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific freezing spray scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Reduced Visibility Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific reduced visibility scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Large Seas Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific large seas scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Precipitation Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a specific precipitation scenario, event or hazard.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Temperature Message
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A written communication about a temperature parameter.
